New Records: Shadab Khan hit the second-fastest fifty by a Pakistan batter in T20I cricket with 50 off just 20 balls.
Key Match Events: South Africa were 16 runs behind the DLS par score at the end of the 9th over.
South Africa's chase of 186 was interrupted by rain in Sydney.
Shadab Khan hit a 22-ball 52 and picked up 2 wickets.
Shaheen Afridi and Shadab Khan dented South Africa's chase with 2 wickets each.
South Africa needed 142 runs in 14 overs in the curtailed match.
Pakistan posted 185 on the board in 20 overs despite losing captain Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan early.
South Africa lost opener Quinton de Kock (0) and Rilee Rossouw (7) after a wonderful new-ball spell from Shaheen Afridi.
Temba Bavuma scored 36 from 19 balls, taking the attack to Pakistan's key pacer Haris Rauf.
Shadab Khan took the crucial wickets of Bavuma and Markram in the same over.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 14 overs per side.
South Africa were previously impacted by rain in their match against Zimbabwe, resulting in shared points.
South Africa were at the 2nd spot in the Group 2 Super 12 points table while Pakistan needed a win to keep their semi-final hopes alive.
